result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Dustin J. Nelmark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dustin J. Nelmark in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
   DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.
ADA Marcoux moves to amend Counts two (2) and three (3) to straight criminal damage to property and straight disorderly conduct.
DEF pleads N/C on all counts.. 
Court accepts plea on Count one and enters into Deferred Agreement.
Court accepts plea and finds DEF guilty on Counts two and three.
Joint recommendation. Victim notification completed.
Court gives colliqy.
Court approved: Count 1, deferred judgment of conviction pursuant to Deferred Judgment of Conviction Agreement. 
Court orders: Counts 2 & 3, two (2) years probation with conditions:   AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations,   Absolute Sobriety.
Court imposes costs on Counts two (2) and three (3) totaling $ 896.00. 
Restitution of $ 400.00 plus surcharges to be paid to Ron and Laura Zook.

Defendant Dustin J. Nelmark in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  Off the Record - Set next court appearance.
Court: bond continues  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 11:00 am.

No abusive Contact with  -
  ESTHER NELMARK
Statutory Minimum Domestic Abuse Bail Conditions
As a condition of my release from custody in this matter, I agree that I will not engage in any threats or acts of domestic abuse against the victim "  ESTHER NELMARK  " or any other person.
I understand that "domestic abuse" means:
Intentional infliction of physical pain, injury or illness.
Intentional impairment of physical condition. 
First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.

Defendant Dustin J. Nelmark in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Aaron Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.   Counsel enters NG Plea.   Amended Bond Continues.

Defendant Dustin Nelmark in court with Attorney Thomas W. Duffy.  Aaron Marcoux appeared for the state.   Esther Nelmark(wife) in court.  Attny Duffy requests lifting of NO contact provision as per Mrs. Nelmarks request.   Court denies motion, directs victim to Oakwood Haven.  Attny Duffy requests phone contact related to the 4 children.   Court allows use of Mr. Nelmark mother as 3rd Party contact for children to see Dad.
